htmlEmbed:
Protecting Reproductive Rights & Access to Information5/31/2023

The Supreme Court decision in Dobbs v. Jackson Womenâ€™s Health Organization has raised urgent questions about the privacy of people seeking reproductive care. State laws that criminalize abortion, and deputize private citizens to sue, create frightening incentives for law enforcement and civilians to seek out private information about patients and the providers who support them.

Read

<article class="single-post">
<header class="post-header">
<h1 class="the-title">Protecting Reproductive Rights & Access to Information</h1>
</header>
<div class="the-content wysiwyg">
<p> </p>
</div>
</article>
<div class="modules">
<section class="module full-width-media-module">
<img width="1024" height="536" src="https://cdt.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/2023-05-25-Dobbs-collection-branding-191x1-2-2500x-1024x536.png" class="attachment-large size-large" alt="A cell phone, web browser, social media post and text messages all surrounded by multicolor bits of health data." loading="lazy" srcset="https://cdt.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/2023-05-25-Dobbs-collection-branding-191x1-2-2500x-1024x536.png 1024w, https://cdt.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/2023-05-25-Dobbs-collection-branding-191x1-2-2500x-640x335.png 640w, https://cdt.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/2023-05-25-Dobbs-collection-branding-191x1-2-2500x-768x402.png 768w, https://cdt.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/2023-05-25-Dobbs-collection-branding-191x1-2-2500x-1536x804.png 1536w, https://cdt.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/2023-05-25-Dobbs-collection-branding-191x1-2-2500x-2048x1072.png 2048w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" />
</section>
<section class="
	module
	centered-text-module
			centered-text-module--black
	">
<div class="module-description">
<p></p>
<p>The Supreme Court decision in <em>Dobbs v. Jackson Womenâ€™s Health Organization</em> has raised urgent questions about the privacy of people seeking reproductive care. State laws that criminalize abortion, and deputize private citizens to sue, create frightening incentives for law enforcement and civilians to seek out private information about patients and the providers who support them.</p>
<p> </p>
<p> </p>
<p>In the wake of the decision, CDT is mobilizing advocates, providers, and policymakers to protect health data privacy â€“ calling for companies to reform their data practices, supporting state and federal policymakers, and continuing to fight for strong privacy laws.</p>
<p> </p>
<p> </p>
<p>Weâ€™re also working to protect peopleâ€™s access to accurate, reliable, and safe information onlineâ€”pushing back on state laws that seek to censor abortion-related websites, and urging tech companies to combat misleading websites and boost trusted sources online.</p>
<p></p>
</div>
</section>

<div class="module-text">
<h1 class="module-title">
Best Practices for Protecting Reproductive Health Data
</h1>
<div class="box-outline"></div>
<p>This is a practical guide for company decision makers, product designers, developers, advocates, and concerned customers to understand the privacy concerns inherent to many data collection practices, and how companies can act.</p>
<p class="module-call-to-action-container">
<a href="https://cdt.org/insights/report-data-after-dobbs-best-practices-for-protecting-reproductive-health-data/" class="module-call-to-action">
Read Report
</a>
</p>
</div>
<div class="module-media">
<div class="inner-media">
<img width="1024" height="536" src="https://cdt.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/2023-05-03-Data-After-Dobbs-cover-191x1-social-media-2500x-1024x536.png" class="attachment-large size-large" alt="Graphic for CDT report, entitled "Data After Dobbs: Best Practices for Protecting Reproductive Health Data." Phone surrounded by green protective lines and floating multicolor bits of reproductive health data." loading="lazy" srcset="https://cdt.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/2023-05-03-Data-After-Dobbs-cover-191x1-social-media-2500x-1024x536.png 1024w, https://cdt.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/2023-05-03-Data-After-Dobbs-cover-191x1-social-media-2500x-640x335.png 640w, https://cdt.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/2023-05-03-Data-After-Dobbs-cover-191x1-social-media-2500x-768x402.png 768w, https://cdt.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/2023-05-03-Data-After-Dobbs-cover-191x1-social-media-2500x-1536x804.png 1536w, https://cdt.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/2023-05-03-Data-After-Dobbs-cover-191x1-social-media-2500x-2048x1072.png 2048w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" />

<section class="

	media-module--right

<div class="module-text">
<h1 class="module-title">
Field Guide to Blocking Statutes: Limiting Interstate Abortion Investigations
</h1>
<div class="box-outline"></div>
<p>A field guide, drafted by Yale Law Schoolâ€™s Media Law Clinic and supported by CDTÂ to assist state legislatures in protecting against compelled disclosure of reproductive health data that would assist litigation in states criminalizing abortion.</p>
<p class="module-call-to-action-container">
<a href="https://cdt.org/insights/report-field-guide-to-blocking-statutes-limiting-interstate-abortion-investigations/" class="module-call-to-action">
Read Report
</a>
</p>
</div>

readabilityObject.title: Protecting Reproductive Rights & Access to Information
readabilityObject.content:
The Supreme Court decision in Dobbs v. Jackson Womenâ€™s Health Organization has raised urgent questions about the privacy of people seeking reproductive care. State laws that criminalize abortion, and deputize private citizens to sue, create frightening incentives for law enforcement and civilians to seek out private information about patients and the providers who support them.

In the wake of the decision, CDT is mobilizing advocates, providers, and policymakers to protect health data privacy â€“ calling for companies to reform their data practices, supporting state and federal policymakers, and continuing to fight for strong privacy laws.

Weâ€™re also working to protect peopleâ€™s access to accurate, reliable, and safe information onlineâ€”pushing back on state laws that seek to censor abortion-related websites, and urging tech companies to combat misleading websites and boost trusted sources online.

Resources

Best Practices for Protecting Reproductive Health Data

This is a practical guide for company decision makers, product designers, developers, advocates, and concerned customers to understand the privacy concerns inherent to many data collection practices, and how companies can act.

Read Report

Field Guide to Blocking Statutes: Limiting Interstate Abortion Investigations

A field guide, drafted by Yale Law Schoolâ€™s Media Law Clinic and supported by CDT to assist state legislatures in protecting against compelled disclosure of reproductive health data that would assist litigation in states criminalizing abortion.

Read Report
